label: ü•ö Eggs
hover description: **Eggs** include *Chicken Eggs, Duck Eggs, Quail Eggs*

label: üå± Pulses
hover description: **Pulses** include *Lentils, Chickpeas, Black Beans, Kidney Beans, Peas*

label: üåæ Grains
hover description: **Grains** include *Wheat, Rice, Corn, Oats, Barley, Quinoa*

label: üçéü•¶ Vegetables and Fruits
hover description: **Vegetables and Fruits** include Apples, Oranges, Spinach, Cabbage, Broccoli, Tomatoes, Zucchini, and Bell Peppers. Roots and Tubers, such as Carrots, Potatoes, and Turnips, are also included.

label: üåø Other Crops
hover description: **Other Crops** include *Oil Crops, Sugar, Nuts, Spices*

label: Food Loss and Waste
description: Use 'Custom' to adjust food loss and waste in the supply chain.
hover description: How much food loss and waste can we try to cut?

label: üöú Primary Production
varname: FWL Fraction Variation by Supply Chain[PrimaryProduction]
empty: Losses occurring at the farm level due to unharvested crops, pest damage, extreme weather, or overproduction that leads to surplus food being discarded before it enters the supply chain.
hover description: **Primary Production** is a stage which involves **losses** through *Farmers, Fishers, Ranchers, Agricultural Workers* during initial food production stages.

label: üì¶ Post Harvest
varname: FWL Fraction Variation by Supply Chain[PostHarvest]
empty: Losses happening after harvest but before processing or distribution, often due to inadequate storage, transportation issues, spoilage, or inefficiencies in handling and drying.
hover description: **Post Harvest** is a stage which involves **losses** through *Warehouses, Storage Facilities, Transporters* after harvesting and before processing.

label: üè≠ Processing
varname: FWL Fraction Variation by Supply Chain[Processing]
empty: Losses during food manufacturing, including edible portions discarded during trimming, inefficiencies in processing, and overproduction leading to disposal before reaching consumers.
hover description: **Processing** is a stage which involves **losses** through *Food Manufacturers, Factories, Butchers, Packaging* during food processing.

label: üöö Distribution
varname: FWL Fraction Variation by Supply Chain[Distribution]
empty: Wastes occurring at the wholesale, retail, and food service levels due to packaging damage, expired goods, improper handling, or rejection of products based on aesthetic standards.
hover description: **Distribution** is a stage which involves **losses** and **waste** through *Wholesalers, Retailers, Supermarkets, Deliveries* in the supply chain.

label: üçΩÔ∏è Consumption
varname: FWL Fraction Variation by Supply Chain[Consumption]
empty: Wastes generated at the consumer level, including uneaten leftovers, spoiled groceries, and plate waste in households, restaurants, and cafeterias
hover description: **Consumption** is a stage which involves **wastes** through *Households, Consumers, Restaurants, Cafeterias* at the final consumption stage.

label: Diet Change
description: How do behaviour change drivers influence global diet shifts?

label: üîì Self Efficacy
hover description:
If you feel confident in yourself to make dietary changes, you are also more likely to shift toward sustainable eating habits.

**Self Efficacy** refers to an individual's belief in their ability to successfully adopt and maintain a different diet.

label: üéØ Response Efficacy
hover description:
If you trust that your actions have impact, you are more likely to change your behavior.

**Response Efficacy** reflects the belief that adopting a different diet will effectively contribute to positive environmental or health outcomes.

label: ‚ö†Ô∏è Perceived Risks
hover description:
If you perceive greater risks from the environment, you may be more likely to adopt dietary changes.

**Perceived Risks** is affected by both the sensitivity towards extreme events but also its frequency.

label: üë• Social Norms
hover description:
If sustainable eating is widely accepted among your peers you are also more likely to adopt such diets.

**Social Norms** refer to the influence of societal and peer expectations on an individual's diet choices.

label: Period of Behaviour Change
description: When will we start changing and how long will it take?

label: Diet Change
hover description: This slider controls the start and end year of the diet change scenario, assuming that changes will follow an S-shaped curve.

label: FLW
hover description: This slider controls the start and end year of the food waste scenario, assuming that changes will follow an S-shaped curve.

label: AP
hover description: This slider controls the start and end year of the alternative protein scenario, assuming that changes will follow an S-shaped curve.

label: Socioeconomic Drivers (SSPs)
hover description:
**Shared Socioeconomic Pathways** (SSP) describe alternative future pathways of societal development, including changes in population, economic growth, education, and technology.

It serve as key external drivers for assessing human vulnerability, adaptive capacity, and the scale of climate impacts and mitigation challenges.

label: Emission Trajectories for Other Gases (RCPs)
hover description:
**Representative Concentration Pathways** (RCP) represent different levels of future climate forcing by 2100, from very low (1.9 W/m2) to very high (8.5 W/m2) emissions.

This serves as a key external driver variable for influencing a wide range of climate impacts including mortality, agricultural productivity and biodiversity.
